messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Dissolving in Cola, was Re: parent's issues food ...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/26/2005 10:03:35 AM Mountain Standard Time, sheran@ptd.net writes: The  tooth was still there, but was all rotted and black and  icky. ...
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/26/2005 10:03:35 AM Mountain Standard Time,
sheran@... writes:

The tooth was still there, but was all rotted and black and icky.

---------

Did you try to clean it off? Was the "black and icky" just coke-sludge?


Marty got some teeth pulled last week. Maybe he'd be willing to donate one.
Teeth (removed, outside of people or animals) kinda gross me out,
personally. Hair and fingernails too. Any people-parts. My granny had a book of
hair of relatives and ancestors. It was like graveyard-in-a-drawer for me
when I was little. I don't know who ended up with it, but it was gross. The
thought that someday I could clone all my ancestors does NOT cheer me up at
all. That was my mom's family and should stay in the drawer for sure.

I don't think coke will dissolve hair, either.

Sandra


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
